meanings.definition: A brief excursion or attempt into a new area or activity
meanings.sent1: The children's foray into the forest was filled with excitement and wonder.
meanings.sent2: Her foray into painting opened up a whole new world of creativity for her.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's foray into the mud resulted in a messy but fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: His foray into cooking led to a delicious meal that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The foray into stargazing on the clear night revealed a sky full of twinkling stars.

meanings.definition: To make a raid or brief invasion
meanings.sent1: The pirates decided to foray the enemy ship under the cover of night.
meanings.sent2: The army forayed the enemy camp, catching them off guard.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons forayed the garbage cans in search of a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: The kids forayed the kitchen for cookies when no one was looking.
meanings.sent5: The wolves forayed the sheep pen, causing chaos among the flock.

meanings.sent1: She decided to foray into the world of photography, starting with simple shots.
